---------------------------------------------------------------------

A new Pogues box set, 30 Years, is released by Rhino in December 2013.
This eight CD collection contains the albums Red Roses for Me, Rum Sodomy and the Lash, If I Should Fall from Grace with God, Peace and Love, HellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ditch, Waiting for Herb, and Pogue Mahone. A previously unissued live album The Pogues with Joe Strummer Live in London is also included.
Red Roses for Me has been newly remixed from the original tapes by longtime Pogues engineer Nick Robbins, while 1989's Peace and Love has been remixed by original producer Steve Lillywhite.
A bonus disc includes a complete concert from the London Forum at the end of 1991, when Joe Strummer was the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s frontman. The group tears through a 22-song set featuring a few choice tunes from The ClashÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s discography. (Three of these tracks were released on 2008's Just Look Them Straight in the Eye and SayÃ¢â‚¬Â¦Pogue Mahone!! The Pogues Box Set, which was reissued in a smaller package earlier this year.)

The rest of the CDs use the 2004 remasters
